snippet: College football's grim season ends with a dud of a championship game as Alabama wins ugly and Louisiana State comes up empty.
abstract: College football's grim season ends with a dud of a championship game as Alabama wins ugly and Louisiana State comes up empty.
lead_paragraph: If you were trying to get the college football system torn up and thrown out, you couldn't have orchestrated the end of this season any more persuasively. Yes, Alabama took all the drama out of who should be No. 1 with its 21-0 victory over thought-to-be-unbeatable Louisiana State Monday night, but what a small victory that turned out to be. It capped the year of Jerry Sandusky and Joe Paterno's fall, of Ohio State's probation forming the other big rapids in a raging river of ethical failures and misplaced priorities. It came at the end of a string of uninspired, made-for-bad-TV bowls, played so far after the season ended that even the major players needed name tags. And the finale was a conference rematch about as attractive as a Kris Humphries-Kim Kardashian reunion.

headline.main: Leading Off: Bad Season Ends Worse
